TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit Pair extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a basic utility class that is used to store two related objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Pair> class is used as a basic structure to store two related objects. It is a utility class that is used in various ways throughout ASP.NET, such as during page state management tasks or in configuration section handlers. You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Pair> class in your own code anywhere that you need a structure to contain two related objects and where data hiding is not essential. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Pair> class does not encapsulate its object references, <xref:System.Web.UI.Pair.First> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Pair.Second>, in properties; it exposes them directly to all calling code as public class fields.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Pair> class can be used in several ways in page state persistence implementations. The most common use is as a container for both the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister.ControlState%2A> collections. In this case, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Pair.First> property is used for <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Pair.Second> for <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister.ControlState%2A>.
